0:
Ingredients Used:
      - Salt
      - Black Salt
      - Asafoetida
      - Fennel Seeds
      - Jaggery
      - Red Chilli Powder
      - Mango
      - Methi Seeds
      - Cumin Seeds
      - Turmeric Powder
      - Garam Masala Powder
      - Sunflower Oil

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: To prepare a Mango Pickle, first soak the methi seeds and fennel seeds separately in water for about an hour.
      - Step 2: Grind the soaked methi seeds, cumin seeds, and turmeric powder into a smooth paste using little water.
      - Step 3: Add chopped mango pieces, asafoetida, red chilli powder, jaggery, black salt, and garam masala powder to the paste. Mix well.
      - Step 4: Heat sunflower oil in a pan and temper it with cumin seeds. Pour the hot oil over the pickle mixture.
      - Step 5: Allow the pickle to rest for at least 2 days before serving. It can be stored in an airtight container for up to a month.
1:
Ingredients Used:
    - Salt
    - Green Beans
    - Raisins
    - Black Peppercorns
    - Carrot
    - Virgin Olive Oil
    - Coriander Leaves
    - Dijon Mustard
    - Potato
    - Red Onion

   Instructions:
    - Step 1: Boil the potatoes and green beans until they are cooked. Drain and set aside.
    - Step 2: Grate the carrot and chop the red onion finely.
    - Step 3: In a pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
    - Step 4: Add the grated carrot to the pan and cook for a few minutes.
    - Step 5: Crush the black peppercorns and mix them with salt, coriander leaves, and Dijon mustard.
    - Step 6: Combine the cooked potatoes, green beans, pepper-coriander mixture, and raisins in a large bowl. Mix well.
    - Step 7: Serve this carrot, potato, and green bean salad as a side dish for your meal.
2:
Ingredients Used:
      - Tomato
      - Salt
      - Cumin Powder
      - Coriander Leaves
      - Sev Variety
      - Chaat Masala Powder
      - Red Chilli Powder
      - Onion
      - Lemon
      - Peanuts
      - Cucumber
      - Turmeric Powder
      - Sunflower Oil

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: To prepare Spicy Peanut Chaat, first chop the onion and tomato.
      - Step 2: In a bowl, combine chopped onions, tomatoes, peeled and crushed peanuts, salt, cumin powder, coriander leaves, chaat masala powder, red chilli powder, and turmeric powder.
      - Step 3: Squeeze lemon juice over the mixture and mix well.
      - Step 4: Top the prepared Spicy Peanut Chaat with sev variety and serve it as a snack.
3:
Ingredients Used:
      - Rice
      - Sunflower Oil
      - Mustard Seeds
      - Cashew Nuts
      - Salt
      - Coconut
      - Asafoetida
      - Ghee
      - Dry Red Chilli
      - Curry Leaves
      - Coriander Leaves
      - White Urad Dal

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: Wash and soak rice for 30 minutes. Cook the rice separately.
      - Step 2: In a pan, heat sunflower oil. Add mustard seeds, cashew nuts, asafoetida, dry red chilli, and curry leaves.
      - Step 3: When the mustard seeds crackle, add white urad dal and sauté until it turns golden brown.
      - Step 4: Reduce the heat and stir in grated coconut and coriander leaves.
      - Step 5: Mix the tempered ingredients with cooked rice and serve as a side dish with any main Indian meal.
4:
Ingredients Used:
      - Tomato
      - Spring onion greens
      - Ginger
      - Corn flour
      - Cloves garlic
      - Soy sauce
      - Chilli vinegar
      - Water
      - Green bell pepper
      - Onion
      - Soy
      - Red chilli sauce
      - Green chillies
      - Sunflower oil

   Instructions:
    - Step 1: To prepare spicy corn fritters, first mix corn flour with water to make a batter.
    - Step 2: Add finely chopped ginger, minced garlic, and green chillies to the batter.
    - Step 3: Stir in diced tomato, spring onion greens, and cubed green bell pepper into the batter.
    - Step 4: Heat sunflower oil in a pan. Drop spoonfuls of the batter into the hot oil.
    - Step 5: Fry the fritters until golden brown on both sides.
    - Step 6: Drain excess oil from fried fritters and serve them with soy sauce, chilli vinegar, and red chilli sauce for dipping.
    - Step 7: This dish can be enjoyed as a snack or paired with rice for dinner.
5:
Ingredients Used:
      - Gram Wheat Flour
      - Baking Powder
      - Baking Soda
      - Orange
      - Orange Juice
      - Sugar
      - Chocolate Chips
      - Brown Sugar
      - Eggs
      - Butter
      - Gram Vivatta Maida

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
      - Step 2: In a large bowl, whisk together gram wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda and gram vivatta maida.
      - Step 3: In another bowl, beat eggs, sugar, orange juice and melted butter until smooth.
      - Step 4: Combine the wet ingredients with the dry ingredients and mix well. Fold in chocolate chips.
      - Step 5: Pour the batter into a greased baking dish or muffin tins.
      - Step 6: Bake for about 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
      - Step 7: Allow to cool before serving with a slice of orange. Enjoy!
6:
Ingredients Used:
    - Chicken Thighs
    - Hung Curd
    - Lemon
    - Ginger Paste
    - Garam Masala Powder
    - Kashmiri Red Chilli Powder
    - Coriander Powder
    - Salt
    - Black Salt
    - Mustard Oil
    - Ghee
    - Chaat Masala Powder

   Instructions:
    - Step 1: Marinate chicken thighs with ginger paste, lemon juice, garam masala powder, kashmiri red chilli powder, coriander powder, salt and black salt. Let it rest for at least 30 minutes.
    - Step 2: Heat a combination of mustard oil and ghee in a pan. Cook the marinated chicken until fully cooked.
    - Step 3: In a separate bowl, beat hung curd to smooth consistency. Season with salt, black salt, chaat masala powder, and a pinch of kashmiri red chilli powder.
    - Step 4: Serve the cooked chicken with the seasoned hung curd as a side dish for dinner. Enjoy!
7:
Ingredients Used:
      - Sesame Seeds (Dry)
      - Mustard Seeds
      - Garlic Cloves
      - Curry Leaves
      - White Urad Dal
      - Dry Red Chillies
      - Cumin Seeds
      - Green Amaranth Leaves
      - Turmeric Powder
      - Green Chillies

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: Roast sesame seeds, mustard seeds, cumin seeds and dry red chillies in a pan without oil until they release aroma.
      - Step 2: In another pan, heat some oil and sauté garlic cloves and curry leaves till the garlic is slightly golden.
      - Step 3: Add the roasted ingredients from step 1 to the garlic-curry leaves mixture in the pan. Sauté for a minute.
      - Step 4: Stir in turmeric powder, then add washed green amaranth leaves and cook until wilted.
      - Step 5: Serve this stir fry with steamed white urad dal or enjoy it as a side dish to complete your meal.
8:
Ingredients Used:
    - Salt
    - Green Beans
    - Ginger
    - Red Chilli Powder
    - Carrot
    - Garlic
    - Cumin Seeds
    - Black Pepper Powder
    - Coriander Powder

   Instructions:
    - Step 1: Wash and chop the green beans into small pieces. Grate the carrot. Finely chop ginger and garlic.
    - Step 2: Heat a pan, add cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
    - Step 3: Add chopped ginger, garlic, and green beans to the pan. Saute until tender.
    - Step 4: Add grated carrot and cook for another minute.
    - Step 5: Sprinkle red chilli powder, black pepper powder, and coriander powder over the mixture in the pan. Stir well to combine.
    - Step 6: Cook for another minute, then remove from heat.
    - Step 7: Your Green Beans Tempered with Spices is ready. Serve it as a side dish alongside rice or roti for dinner.
9:
Ingredients Used:
      - Salt
      - Red Chilli Powder
      - Curd (yogurt)
      - Lemon
      - Mustard Seeds (ground powder)
      - Turmeric Powder
      - Sarsaparilla (also known as Safed Musali or Indian Sarsaparilla)

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: Combine the salt, red chilli powder, curd, juice of a lemon, mustard seeds ground powder, turmeric powder and sarsaparilla in a large bowl.
      - Step 2: Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed. Your preparation is now ready.
      - Step 3: Serve this tangy yogurt-based dish as a side for lunch with steamed rice or a spicy lentil curry such as Chana Masala or Dal Makhani.
10:
Ingredients Used:
      - Pistachios
      - Ghee
      - Sugar
      - Aloe Vera
      - Milk (Full Fat)

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: Crush the pistachios coarsely.
      - Step 2: In a pan, heat the ghee over medium flame.
      - Step 3: Add the crushed pistachios to the heated ghee and sauté until aromatic.
      - Step 4: Remove the pan from heat and stir in sugar.
      - Step 5: Blend the aloe vera and milk together in a blender to make a smooth paste.
      - Step 6: Combine the pistachio-ghee mixture, aloe vera-milk paste, and mix well. Your dessert is ready.
      - Step 7: Serve this sweet dish as a side or garnish.
11:
Ingredients Used:
      - Salt
      - Black Salt
      - Cardamom Pods Seeds (Black)
      - Amchur
      - Asafoetida
      - Fennel Seeds
      - Water
      - Dry Ginger Powder
      - Sugar
      - Cumin Seeds
      - Pineapple Juice
      - Lemon
      - Black Pepper Powder
      - Jal Jeera Powder
      - Mint Powder

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: To prepare a refreshing Mint-Pineapple Iced Tea, first, boil water.
      - Step 2: Add cardamom pods seeds, cumin seeds, and fennel seeds to the boiling water. Let it simmer for a few minutes.
      - Step 3: Strain the spices out of the water and add sugar, black salt, dry ginger powder, jal jeera powder, mint powder, and lemon juice. Stir well until sugar is completely dissolved.
      - Step 4: Allow the tea mixture to cool. Once it's cold, add pineapple juice and mix gently.
      - Step 5: Serve chilled with ice cubes for a refreshing drink. Enjoy!
12:
Ingredients Used:
    - Baking Powder
    - Salt
    - Buttermilk (Cold)
    - Baking Soda
    - Flour
    - Butter

   Instructions:
    - Step 1: To prepare Buttermilk Biscuits, combine baking powder, salt, and flour in a large bowl.
    - Step 2: In another bowl, whisk cold buttermilk.
    - Step 3: Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ones and mix until just combined.
    - Step 4: Add baking soda to the batter and gently fold it in.
    - Step 5: Cut small pieces of butter and incorporate them into the dough, ensuring not to overwork the mixture.
    - Step 6: Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
    - Step 7: Bake at 450°F (232°C) for about 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.
    - Step 8: Serve warm as an accompaniment to your choice of Indian dishes like Garlic Dal, gourd elder greens, and phulka.
13:
Ingredients Used:
    - Tomato
    - Coriander
    - Cumin Powder
    - Ginger
    - Salt
    - Cardamom Pods & Seeds
    - Cloves of Garlic
    - Onion
    - Cinnamon Stick
    - Rajma (Red Kidney Beans)
    - Turmeric Powder
    - Butter
    - Garam Masala Powder
    - Sunflower Oil

   Instructions:
    - Step 1: Soak the red kidney beans (rajma) overnight. Drain and pressure cook them with turmeric powder, salt, cumin powder, cardamom pods, cloves, cinnamon stick, and garam masala powder. Cook until tender.
    - Step 2: Heat sunflower oil in a pan. Add finely chopped onion and grated ginger. Sauté until the onions turn translucent.
    - Step 3: Add the cooked rajma along with the seasoned water from cooking to the pan. Cook for a few minutes.
    - Step 4: In a separate pan, heat butter and add finely chopped tomatoes. Cook until they soften.
    - Step 5: Combine the tomato mixture and the cooked rajma in a large bowl. Mix well and adjust seasonings if needed.
    - Step 6: Serve the Rajma Curry with steamed basmati rice or phulka (Indian flatbread) for dinner. Garnish with chopped coriander before serving.
14:
Ingredients Used:
      - Salt
      - Milk
      - Red Chilli Powder
      - Cloves of Garlic
      - Mozzarella Cheese
      - Virgin Olive Oil
      - Onion
      - Potato
      - Soy
      - Eggs
      - Spinach Leaves
      - Garam Masala Powder
      - Pepper

   Instructions:
    - Step 1: Prepare all the ingredients. Peel and chop the onion, potato, garlic, and spinach leaves.
    - Step 2: Boil potatoes until tender.
    - Step 3: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add finely chopped garlic to the oil and sauté until it releases its aroma.
    - Step 4: Add chopped onions and cook until they become translucent.
    - Step 5: Stir in red chilli powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Cook for a minute.
    - Step 6: Add the boiled potatoes, soy sauce, eggs (beat before adding), and stir well to mix all ingredients.
    - Step 7: Finally, add spinach leaves and cook until they wilt.
    - Step 8: Serve this dish with a side of cheese (Mozzarella) sprinkled on top.
15:
Ingredients Used:
    - Saffron strands (generous amount)
    - Ghee
    - Paneer
    - Rose water
    - Water
    - Sugar
    - Cardamom powder

   Instructions:
    - Step 1: Combine saffron strands with warm rose water and soak for about 30 minutes.
    - Step 2: In a pan, heat ghee over medium flame.
    - Step 3: Crumble paneer into the heated ghee. Fry until golden brown.
    - Step 4: Add sugar and cardamom powder to the fried paneer. Mix well.
    - Step 5: Drain the soaked saffron strands, retaining the rose water. Add this liquid to the pan. Stir gently.
    - Step 6: Your sweetened Paneer with Saffron is ready. Serve warm as a dessert or as an accompaniment to your choice of Indian dishes.
16:
Ingredients Used:
      - Arborio Rice
      - Vegetable Stock/Chicken Broth
      - Dry White Wine
      - Butter
      - Salt
      - Black Pepper Powder
      - Basil Leaves
      - Parmesan Cheese
      - Onion

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: Cook the arborio rice according to package instructions using vegetable/chicken broth and white wine instead of plain water.
      - Step 2: Sauté diced onions in butter until softened.
      - Step 3: Add cooked rice, salt, black pepper, and torn basil leaves to the sautéed onions. Stir well.
      - Step 4: Sprinkle parmesan cheese over the risotto and serve warm.
      Note: This dish is not traditionally Indian but can be served with an Indian side such as Naan or Samosa for a fusion twist.
17:
Ingredients Used:
    - Ghee
    - Milk
    - Saffron Strands
    - Sugar
    - Cardamom Powder
    - Quinoa
    - Condensed Milk (Khoya)
    - Mixed Nuts

   Instructions:
    - Step 1: In a heavy bottomed pan, heat ghee.
    - Step 2: Add saffron strands to the hot ghee and allow it to infuse for a minute.
    - Step 3: Stir in the milk and sugar, followed by cardamom powder.
    - Step 4: Cook on low heat, stirring occasionally until the milk thickens slightly.
    - Step 5: Add quinoa and cook till it is soft and well coated with the milk mixture.
    - Step 6: Stir in condensed milk (khoya) and mixed nuts to garnish.
    - Step 7: Serve warm as a dessert or chilled as a pudding.
18:
Ingredients Used:
    - Salt
    - Tamarind water
    - Mustard seeds
    - Asafoetida
    - Water
    - Gram flour (besan)
    - Spring onion
    - Dry red chillies
    - Coriander seeds
    - Cumin seeds
    - Methi seeds
    - Turmeric powder
    - Sunflower oil

   Instructions:
    - Step 1: In a pan, heat sunflower oil.
    - Step 2: Add mustard seeds, asafoetida, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, and dry red chillies to the hot oil. Allow them to splutter.
    - Step 3: Reduce heat and stir in gram flour (besan) and turmeric powder. Mix well with the spices until the raw smell disappears.
    - Step 4: Gradually add water, tamarind water, and salt. Whisk continuously to prevent lumps. Cook on medium heat until the mixture thickens into a gravy consistency.
    - Step 5: Garnish with chopped spring onion and serve the dish hot with steamed rice or roti.
19:
Ingredients Used:
      - Chicken
      - Curd
      - Mustard Oil
      - Ghee
      - Salt
      - Black Cardamom
      - Asafoetida
      - Bay Leaf
      - Cumin Seeds
      - Cloves
      - Cinnamon Stick
      - Fennel Powder
      - Mint Leaves (Dry)

   Instructions:
     - Step 1: Wash and clean the chicken. In a large pan, heat mustard oil and ghee.
     - Step 2: Add cumin seeds, cloves, bay leaf, black cardamom, and asafoetida to the hot oil.
     - Step 3: When the spices sizzle, add the chicken pieces and stir fry until they are seared on all sides.
     - Step 4: Reduce heat, cover the pan, and cook the chicken till it is tender.
     - Step 5: Once the chicken is cooked, season with salt and sprinkle fennel powder over it. Garnish with mint leaves (dry).
     - Step 6: Serve this aromatic chicken dish hot with steamed basmati rice or naan.

0:
Ingredients Used:
       - Salt
       - Black salt
       - Asafoetida
       - Fennel seeds
       - Jaggery
       - Red chilli powder
       - Mango
       - Methi seeds
       - Cumin seeds
       - Turmeric powder
       - Garam masala powder
       - Sunflower oil

   Instructions:
       - Step 1: To prepare a Spiced Mango Chutney, heat sunflower oil in a pan.
       - Step 2: Add cumin seeds and fennel seeds to the hot oil. Let them sizzle for a few seconds.
       - Step 3: Add chopped mango, asafoetida, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and garam masala powder. Cook on medium heat for 2 minutes.
       - Step 4: Add jaggery and stir until it melts completely.
       - Step 5: Lower the heat, add methi seeds, and cook for another 5 minutes or until the chutney thickens.
       - Step 6: Allow the Spiced Mango Chutney to cool before serving with your main meal.
1:
Ingredients Used:
       - Salt
       - Green Beans
       - Raisins
       - Black Peppercorns
       - Carrot
       - Virgin Olive Oil
       - Coriander Leaves
       - Dijon Mustard
       - Potato
       - Red Onion

   Instructions:
       - Step 1: Boil the potatoes and green beans separately until tender.
       - Step 2: Grate the carrot and finely chop the red onion.
       - Step 3: In a large pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until they become translucent.
       - Step 4: Crush the black peppercorns and add them to the pan along with the grated carrot and dijon mustard. Mix well.
       - Step 5: Add the boiled potatoes and green beans to the pan, combine all ingredients.
       - Step 6: Garnish with coriander leaves and your dish is ready to be served.
2:
Ingredients Used:
      - Tomato
      - Salt
      - Cumin Powder
      - Coriander Leaves
      - Sev Variety
      - Chaat Masala Powder
      - Red Chilli Powder
      - Onion
      - Lemon
      - Peanuts
      - Cucumber
      - Turmeric Powder
      - Sunflower Oil

   Instructions:
     - Step 1: Dice the tomato, onion, and cucumber.
     - Step 2: In a large bowl, combine diced tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, salt, cumin powder, coriander leaves, chaat masala powder, red chilli powder, and turmeric powder.
     - Step 3: Add lemon juice to the mixture and mix well.
     - Step 4: Garnish with sev variety and crushed peanuts before serving. This dish is best enjoyed as a chaat.
3:
Ingredients Used:
        - Cashew nuts
        - Salt
        - Sunflower oil
        - Rice
        - Mustard seeds
        - Coconut (grated)
        - Asafoetida
        - Ghee
        - Dry red chilli
        - Curry leaves
        - Coriander leaves
        - White urad dal

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: To prepare a South Indian dish, roast the cashew nuts and keep them aside.
      - Step 2: Cook the rice separately and let it cool.
      - Step 3: Heat sunflower oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, asafoetida, dry red chilli, and curry leaves.
      - Step 4: Once the mustard seeds crackle, add the cooked white urad dal to the pan and roast it until golden brown.
      - Step 5: Add the cooked rice, roasted cashews, grated coconut, salt, and coriander leaves to the pan. Mix well.
      - Step 6: Serve this South Indian dish with a side of spicy sambar or a yogurt-based raita for a complete meal.
4:
Ingredients Used:
       - Tomato
       - Spring onion greens
       - Ginger
       - Corn flour
       - Cloves garlic
       - Soy sauce
       - Chilli vinegar
       - Water
       - Green bell pepper
       - Onion
       - Soy
       - Red chilli sauce
       - Green chillies
       - Sunflower oil

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: Prepare all the ingredients. Dice tomatoes, chop spring onions, ginger, and green bell pepper. Crush garlic.
      - Step 2: In a large bowl, combine diced tomatoes, chopped spring onion greens, minced ginger, corn flour, crushed garlic, soy sauce, chilli vinegar, and water. Mix well.
      - Step 3: Add finely sliced green bell pepper, chopped onions, red chilli sauce, and green chillies to the mixture. Mix again.
      - Step 4: Heat sunflower oil in a pan and pour the prepared mixture into it. Cook until the mixture thickens.
      - Step 5: Serve this spicy and tangy stir-fry with steamed rice or flatbread for dinner. Enjoy!
5:
Ingredients Used:
      - Gram Wheat Flour (Atta)
      - Baking Powder
      - Orange
      - Baking Soda
      - Orange Juice
      - Sugar
      - Chocolate Chips
      - Brown Sugar
      - Eggs
      - Butter
      - Gram Vivatta Maida (All-purpose Flour)

   Instructions:
    - Step 1: Prepare all the ingredients first.
    - Step 2: Beat eggs and sugar together in a large bowl.
    - Step 3: Add melted butter to the egg mixture and mix well.
    - Step 4: Combine gram wheat flour, baking powder, and baking soda in another bowl.
    - Step 5: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with orange juice. Mix until just combined.
    - Step 6: Fold in chocolate chips.
    - Step 7: Pour the batter into a greased cake pan.
    - Step 8: Bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
    - Step 9: Allow the cake to cool before serving.
6:
Ingredients Used:
      - Salt
      - Black Salt
      - Hung Curd
      - Kashmiri Red Chilli Powder
      - Coriander Powder
      - Mustard Oil
      - Ghee
      - Chaat Masala Powder
      - Chicken Thighs
      - Lemon
      - Ginger Paste
      - Garam Masala Powder

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: Marinate the chicken thighs with ginger paste, lemon juice, salt, black salt, red chilli powder, coriander powder, chaat masala powder and garam masala powder. Keep it aside for 30 minutes.
      - Step 2: Heat a mixture of mustard oil and ghee in a pan. Cook the marinated chicken thighs until they are fully cooked.
      - Step 3: Serve the chicken with rice, or Indian flatbread (phulka), and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Enjoy!
7:
Ingredients Used:
       - Sesame seeds (dry)
       - Mustard seeds
       - Cloves garlic
       - Curry leaves
       - White urad dal
       - Dry red chillies
       - Cumin seeds
       - Green amaranth leaves
       - Turmeric powder
       - Green chillies

   Instructions:
       - Step 1: Heat a pan and add sesame seeds, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and dry red chillies.
       - Step 2: Once the seeds start spluttering, add minced garlic and curry leaves. Sauté for a minute.
       - Step 3: Add white urad dal to the pan and cook until it turns soft.
       - Step 4: In a separate bowl, combine washed green amaranth leaves, turmeric powder, salt, and chopped green chillies.
       - Step 5: Add the tempered spices from the pan to the bowl containing the greens and mix well.
       - Step 6: Your side dish with green amaranth leaves is ready. Serve it alongside a main Indian dish like Garlic Dal, for dinner.
8:
Ingredients Used:
        - Salt
        - Green Beans
        - Ginger
        - Red Chilli Powder
        - Carrot
        - Garlic
        - Cumin Seeds
        - Black Pepper Powder
        - Coriander Powder

   Instructions:
       - Step 1: To prepare a spiced carrot and green beans stir fry, first, wash and chop the vegetables.
       - Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Allow them to splutter.
       - Step 3: Add finely chopped ginger and garlic to the pan and sauté until fragrant.
       - Step 4: Add the chopped green beans and carrot, stir fry on medium heat for about 5 minutes.
       - Step 5: Sprinkle red chilli powder, coriander powder, salt, and black pepper powder over the vegetables. Stir well to evenly coat them with spices.
       - Step 6: Cover the pan and cook for another 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.
       - Step 7: Your spiced carrot and green beans stir fry is ready to be served with rice or roti for a delicious Indian meal.
9:
Ingredients Used:
       - Salt
       - Red Chilli Powder
       - Curd
       - Lemon
       - Ground Mustard Seeds Powder
       - Turmeric Powder
       - Sarsaparilla

   Instructions:
       - Step 1: To prepare this dish, first, let's make a tempering. Heat oil in a pan.
       - Step 2: Add mustard seeds and allow them to splutter.
       - Step 3: Now, add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, and sarsaparilla to the tempering. Stir well.
       - Step 4: Pour this tempering over the curd in a serving bowl.
       - Step 5: Squeeze lemon juice over the curd and mix gently.
       - Step 6: Your dish is ready. Serve it as a side with rice or flatbread for a complete meal.
10:
Ingredients Used:
       - Pistachios
       - Ghee
       - Sugar
       - Aloe Vera
       - Milk (Full Fat)

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: Grind pistachios into a smooth paste.
      - Step 2: Heat ghee in a pan, add the ground pistachio paste and sugar. Cook until sugar dissolves completely.
      - Step 3: Add aloe vera gel to the pan, mix well with the cooked mixture.
      - Step 4: Slowly pour milk into the pan while stirring continuously. Simmer for a few minutes until it thickens.
      - Step 5: Your Indian Aloe Vera and Pistachio Milk is ready to serve as a dessert or beverage.
11:
Ingredients Used:
      - Salt
      - Black Salt
      - Cardamom pods seeds (black)
      - Amchur (dried mango powder)
      - Asafoetida
      - Fennel seeds
      - Water
      - Dry Ginger Powder
      - Sugar
      - Cumin Seeds
      - Pineapple juice
      - Lemon
      - Black Pepper Powder
      - Jal Jeera Powder (jeera with salt, black pepper, and other spices)
      - Mint Powder

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: In a pan, combine water, cardamom pods seeds, asafoetida, fennel seeds, and dry ginger powder. Bring it to boil on medium heat.
      - Step 2: Once the mixture begins to boil, add black salt, sugar, cumin seeds, jal jeera powder, and mint powder. Stir well.
      - Step 3: Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 5 minutes. Let it cool slightly.
      - Step 4: Strain the mixture into a serving dish, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
      - Step 5: Squeeze pineapple juice and lemon over the strained mixture. Serve chilled with rice or any other Indian main course for an invigorating meal.
12:
Ingredients Used:
      - Baking Powder
      - Salt
      - Buttermilk (cold)
      - Baking Soda
      - Flour
      - Butter

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: To prepare buttermilk biscuits, first preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).
      - Step 2: In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda.
      - Step 3: Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
      - Step 4: Gradually stir in buttermilk with a fork until dough forms.
      - Step 5: Turn dough onto lightly floured surface; gently knead 6-8 times.
      - Step 6: Roll dough to 1/2-inch thickness. Cut into circles using a biscuit cutter.
      - Step 7: Place circles on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown.
      - Step 8: Serve with your favorite Indian dish, such as Garlic Dal, gourd elder greens, or phulka.
13:

      - Butter

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: Soak the rajma overnight in enough water. Drain and set aside.
      - Step 2: Heat sunflower oil in a large pan. Add cinnamon stick, cardamom pods seeds, cloves garlic, and chopped onion. Saute until onion is translucent.
      - Step 3: Add the drained soaked rajma to the pan, along with turmeric powder, salt, and ginger. Stir well.
      - Step 4: Cook the rajma on medium heat for about 20-25 minutes or until tender.
      - Step 5: Lower the heat, add butter, garam masala powder, and diced tomatoes. Mix well and cook for another 5 minutes.
      - Step 6: Garnish with chopped coriander before serving.
      - Step 7: Serve this Rajma curry with phulka (Indian flatbread) or rice for a hearty meal.

   Instructions:

       - Step 3: Heat oil in a pan, sauté chopped onions, garlic, and spices until fragrant.
       - Step 4: Add mashed potatoes to the pan and mix well.
       - Step 5: Beat eggs and soy together, then pour over the potato mixture while stirring continuously.

15:
Ingredients Used:
       - Saffron strands (generous)
       - Ghee
       - Paneer
       - Rose water
       - Water
       - Sugar
       - Cardamom powder

   Instructions:
       - Step 1: To prepare saffron milk, soak saffron strands in warm water for about 10 minutes.
       - Step 2: Strain the saffron water and combine it with ghee in a heavy-bottomed saucepan.
       - Step 3: Add rose water to the ghee-saffron mixture, followed by sugar and cardamom powder. Stir well.
       - Step 4: Gradually pour in water, stirring continuously. Bring this mixture to a gentle boil on medium heat.
       - Step 5: Reduce the heat and crumble paneer into the saucepan, simmering until it melts completely.
       - Step 6: Your saffron milk pudding is ready! Serve it warm as a dessert or chilled as desired.
16:
Ingredients Used:
       - Arborio Rice
       - Vegetable Stock (Chicken Broth)
       - Onion
       - Dry White Wine
       - Butter
       - Salt
       - Black Pepper Powder
       - Parmesan Cheese
       - Gorgonzola Cheese Cubes
       - Basil Leaves
       - Pizza Pasta Sauce (Marinara Sauce)
       - Wheat Bread Crumbs (Italian Style Seasoned)

   Instructions:
       - Step 1: Cook the Arborio rice in vegetable stock, white wine, and a pinch of salt until the rice is al dente.
       - Step 2: Stir in butter and parmesan cheese to the cooked rice.
       - Step 3: Season with black pepper powder and chopped basil leaves.
       - Step 4: Spread pizza pasta sauce on a baking dish, spoon the risotto over it.

17:
Ingredients Used:
       - Ghee
       - Milk
       - Saffron strands
       - Sugar
       - Cardamom powder
       - Quinoa
       - Condensed milk (Khoya)
       - Mixed Nuts

   Instructions:
       - Step 1: To prepare Saffron-Cardamom Kheer with Quinoa and Nuts, start by heating ghee in a large saucepan.
       - Step 2: Add the cardamom powder to the heated ghee and stir for a few seconds until aromatic.
       - Step 3: Slowly pour milk into the saucepan, followed by the saffron strands and sugar. Stir well.
       - Step 4: Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer over medium heat, then add the quinoa. Cook until the quinoa is tender and the kheer has thickened.
       - Step 5: Stir in the condensed milk (Khoya) and mixed nuts, combining well.
       - Step 6: Simmer for a few more minutes before removing from heat. Allow it to cool slightly before serving.
       - Step 7: Serve the Saffron-Cardamom Kheer with Quinoa and Nuts either warm or chilled as desired. Enjoy your meal!

      - Dry Red Chillies
      - Coriander Seeds
      - Cumin Seeds
      - Methi Seeds
      - Turmeric Powder
      - Sunflower Oil

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: To prepare a spicy gram flour fritter (Besan Cheela), first prepare the batter. In a bowl, mix together gram flour, water, and turmeric powder to make a smooth consistency.
      - Step 2: Heat sunflower oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, methi seeds, and asafoetida. Once they splutter, pour the batter into the pan, spreading it evenly.
      - Step 3: Cook the fritter on one side until golden brown. Flip it over to cook the other side.
      - Step 4: Garnish with chopped spring onion and serve with tamarind water for dipping. Enjoy your Besan Cheela as a delicious snack or light meal!
19:

     - Step 3: Add chicken pieces and cook until well browned.
     - Step 4: In a separate bowl, mix curd, fennel powder, salt, and chopped mint leaves (if fresh, use freshly chopped mint instead of dry).

      - Asafoetida

      - Jaggery

      - Mango

      - Cumin seeds

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: To prepare a unique Indian dish using the provided ingredients, let's make a sweet and spicy Mango Pickle with Phulka (flatbread). First, prepare all the ingredients.
      - Step 2: In a bowl, mix together grated mango, salt, black salt, asafoetida, fennel seeds, jaggery, red chilli powder, and methi seeds.
      - Step 3: Heat sunflower oil in a pan, and add cumin seeds. Once they sizzle, pour the oil over the mango mixture in the bowl.
      - Step 4: Sprinkle turmeric powder and garam masala powder on top of the mango pickle. Stir well to combine all ingredients.
      - Step 5: Cover the bowl with a clean cloth and let it rest for at least 2 hours, or overnight for best results. The longer it sits, the more flavorful it becomes.
      - Step 6: To serve, enjoy the Mango Pickle alongside warm Phulkas (flatbread) as a side dish for dinner.

   Instructions:
     - Step 1: Wash and chop the green beans, potatoes, carrots, and red onions into even pieces. Set aside.
     - Step 2: In a large pan, heat the virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until they become translucent.
     - Step 3: Add the chopped potatoes, carrots, and green beans to the pan. Stir well, cover, and cook until the vegetables are tender.
     - Step 4: Grind black peppercorns and add them to the cooked vegetables along with salt. Mix well.
     - Step 5: In a small bowl, whisk together dijon mustard and coriander leaves to create a dressing. Pour it over the cooked vegetable mixture and stir gently.
     - Step 6: Your Indian-inspired mixed vegetable dish is ready. Serve hot as a side dish or with phulka for dinner.

   Instructions:

     - Step 2: In a separate bowl, mix salt, cumin powder, red chilli powder, chaat masala powder, and turmeric powder.
     - Step 3: Squeeze the juice of one lemon into the spice mixture and stir to form a paste.
     - Step 4: Toss the chopped vegetables in this spice paste.

       - Ghee
       - Dry red chilli
       - Curry leaves

   Instructions:
       - Step 1: Wash and soak rice for at least 30 minutes.
       - Step 2: Grind cashew nuts to a smooth paste and set aside.
       - Step 3: Heat sunflower oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, allow them to crackle.
       - Step 4: Add asafoetida, dry red chilli, curry leaves and sauté for a minute.
       - Step 5: Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pan. Stir well and cook for 2-3 minutes on medium heat.
       - Step 6: Add salt and coconut to the pan and mix well. Cook for another 4-5 minutes until the rice is done.
       - Step 7: In a separate pan, heat ghee, add urad dal and fry until it turns golden brown.
       - Step 8: Mix the fried urad dal with the cooked rice and serve hot as a side dish.

       - Step 2: In a large wok or pan, heat sunflower oil over medium-high heat. Add the cloves of garlic and sauté until fragrant.
       - Step 3: Add the chopped vegetables (tomato, spring onion greens, ginger, green bell pepper, and onion) to the pan. Stir fry for about 5 minutes or until they are tender but still crisp.
       - Step 4: Mix in corn flour, soy sauce, chilli vinegar, red chilli sauce, and green chillies. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly to prevent burning.
       - Step 5: Serve the Indian Stir-Fry with steamed rice or flatbread for dinner. Enjoy your meal!
5:
Ingredients Used:
      - Gram Wheat Flour (Atta)
      - Baking Powder
      - Orange
      - Baking Soda
      - Orange Juice
      - Sugar
      - Chocolate Chips
      - Brown Sugar
      - Eggs
      - Butter
      - Gram Vivatta Maida (All-purpose flour)

   Instructions:
    - Step 1: Prepare the orange juice by squeezing oranges. Set aside.
    - Step 2: In a large bowl, sift together gram wheat flour, baking powder, and baking soda.
    - Step 3: Add brown sugar to the dry ingredients and mix well.
    - Step 4: Beat the eggs in a separate bowl and stir in melted butter.
    - Step 5: Combine the egg mixture with orange juice and gradually add it to the dry ingredients, mixing until just combined.
    - Step 6: Fold in chocolate chips.
    - Step 7: Preheat your oven and grease a baking dish or muffin tin.
    - Step 8: Pour the batter into the prepared dish and bake until golden brown.
    - Step 9: Allow the orange and chocolate chip cake to cool before serving. Enjoy with a hot cup of chai!
6:
Ingredients Used:
      - Hung Curd
      - Salt
      - Black Salt
      - Kashmiri Red Chilli Powder
      - Coriander Powder
      - Mustard Oil
      - Ghee
      - Chaat Masala Powder
      - Chicken Thighs
      - Lemon
      - Ginger Paste
      - Garam Masala Powder
      - Garlic Paste

   Instructions:
    - Step 1: Marinate the chicken thighs by combining ginger paste, garlic paste, Kashmiri red chilli powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder, salt, black salt, and lemon juice in a bowl. Add the chicken thighs to the marinade, coat evenly, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
    - Step 2: Heat mustard oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Remove the chicken from the marinade and cook it in the hot oil until browned and cooked through. Set aside.
    - Step 3: In the same skillet, add ghee and let it melt. Stir in the remaining marinade from the chicken to create a gravy. Cook for a few minutes until fragrant.
    - Step 4: Add water to the skillet, enough to thin the gravy to your desired consistency. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until flavors are well blended.
    - Step 5: Season with chaat masala powder before serving the chicken in the gravy alongside some phulka (Indian flatbread) for dinner. Enjoy!
7:
Ingredients Used:
      - Sesame seeds (dry)
      - Mustard seeds
      - Cloves of garlic
      - Curry leaves
      - White urad dal
      - Dry red chillies
      - Cumin seeds
      - Green amaranth leaves
      - Turmeric powder
      - Green chillies

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: In a pan, heat 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat.
      - Step 2: Add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
      - Step 3: Add cumin seeds, cloves of crushed garlic, and curry leaves to the pan and sauté for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
      - Step 4: Add dry red chillies (broken) and stir continuously for another 20 seconds.
      - Step 5: Reduce heat to low and add turmeric powder, stirring for a few seconds to allow flavors to blend.
      - Step 6: Carefully pour the contents of the pan over a large bowl containing washed green amaranth leaves. Mix well.
      - Step 7: Serve this spiced green amaranth with a side dish made by soaking white urad dal and cooking it until soft, then tempering with more mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves in hot oil, before serving. Enjoy your meal!

    - Step 3: Add chopped garlic and sauté until it turns golden brown.
    - Step 4: Add the chopped green beans, ginger, and carrot to the pan. Stir fry until they are partially cooked but still crunchy.
    - Step 5: Sprinkle red chilli powder, black pepper powder, and coriander powder over the vegetables in the pan. Mix well.
    - Step 6: Cook for another 2-3 minutes, then remove from heat and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

9:

    - Curd (yogurt)

    - Turmeric Powder

Instructions:
    - Step 1: To prepare a tangy yogurt dish with sarsaparilla, first gather all the ingredients.
    - Step 2: In a large bowl, combine curd, lemon juice (squeezed from the lemon), salt, red chilli powder, and turmeric powder. Mix well to incorporate the spices into the yogurt.
    - Step 3: Crush the sarsaparilla root and add it to the yogurt mixture. Stir until evenly distributed.
    - Step 4: Cover the bowl and chill the mixture in the refrigerator for at least an hour to allow the flavors to meld together.
    - Step 5: Serve this tangy yogurt with rice, lentils or roti for a refreshing accompaniment to your meal.
10:

       - Pistachios
       - Ghee
       - Sugar
       - Aloe Vera
       - Milk (Full Fat)

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: Grind the pistachios into a fine powder and set aside.
      - Step 2: Extract the gel from the aloe vera leaf and mix it with sugar to form a syrup.
      - Step 3: Heat ghee in a pan over medium heat.
      - Step 4: Add the pistachio powder to the heated ghee and roast until aromatic.
      - Step 5: Slowly pour the aloe vera sugar syrup into the pan with pistachios and stir well.

      - Step 7: Remove from heat, allow it to cool and then mix in the full-fat milk.

   Instructions:
      - Step 1: To prepare a refreshing pineapple-mint lemonade, first let's mix the spices. In a small bowl, combine cardamom pod seeds, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, asafoetida, and black pepper powder.
      - Step 2: Crush these spices coarsely using a mortar and pestle.
      - Step 3: Next, in a larger bowl, combine sugar, amchur, mint powder (Jal Jeera Powder), lemon juice, pineapple juice, water, and the crushed spice mix. Stir well until all ingredients are combined.

12:
Ingredients Used:
      - Baking Powder
      - Salt
      - Cold Buttermilk
      - Baking Soda
      - Flour
      - Butter

   Instructions:
     - Step 1: To prepare a simple Indian flatbread called 'Phulka', first, combine the flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda in a large bowl.
     - Step 2: Gradually add cold buttermilk to the dry ingredients, mixing until a soft dough forms. Allow the dough to rest for about 15 minutes.
     - Step 3: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball out thinly on a lightly floured surface.
     - Step 4: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Place one rolled-out dough circle in the skillet. Cook until bubbles form on top, then flip and cook until both sides are evenly browned and puffed.
     - Step 5: Apply a little butter to each cooked phulka before serving. Enjoy this soft and fluffy flatbread with your choice of Indian curries for a delicious meal.
13:

    - Onion

   Instructions:

    - Step 3: Stir in turmeric powder, garam masala powder, salt, and drained soaked rajma. Pour enough water to cover the rajma and bring it to a boil. Reduce heat, cover the pot and let it simmer until the rajma is cooked through.

  Instructions:

16:

      - Butter

      - Black Pepper Powder
      - Basil Leaves

   Instructions:

    - Step 3: Pour in dry white wine and allow it to evaporate completely.
    - Step 4: Start adding vegetable/chicken broth, a ladleful at a time, allowing each addition to be absorbed by the rice before adding more. Stir continuously during this process.
    - Step 5: Season with black pepper powder, and when the risotto is cooked (should have a creamy consistency), remove from heat.

      - Quinoa

18:

      - Step 3: Reduce heat to low, stir in gram flour and turmeric powder. Cook for a minute or two while continuously stirring to avoid burning.

     - Step 4: Add chicken pieces to the pot and cook until they are browned on all sides.
     - Step 5: Add salt, fennel powder, and cinnamon stick to the pot. Stir well to combine with the chicken.
     - Step 6: Cover the pot and let it simmer until the chicken is cooked through.
     - Step 7: In a separate bowl, mix chopped mint leaves (dry) into curd.
     - Step 8: Serve the chicken dish with the mint-curd mixture as a side. Enjoy your meal!
